frameDefinitions: In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.

Commerce is a situation in which a Buyer and a Seller have agreed upon an exchange of Money and Goods (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
A Material has been processed (generally industrially) to some Degree in order to make it more useful for some (usually implicit) function.
frameExamples: Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
<fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
The substance which is altered in some useful way.
listRoleExamples: She was considered a <fex>purchaser</fex> of the finest things
<fex>My local grocery store</fex> raised prices on meat
The price of the sweater was <fex> $50</fex>.
She was considered a purchaser <fex>of the finest things</fex>
It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
